http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/tickets/280265-official-members-ticket-sale-update

Main Official Members’ ticket sale – November 14-16
The process for selling tickets for this sale will remain the same. With over 120,000 official LFC Members, supporters are asked for their patience and co-operation in order to make the sales process as smooth as possible.

From 8.15am Tuesday 14th November: Members who recorded a minimum of 13 games wishing to purchase tickets for the following fixtures:

Manchester City; Tottenham Hotspur; West Ham United; Newcastle United; Watford; AFC Bournemouth; Stoke City; Brighton & Hove Albion

Members eligible to purchase tickets during this sale are guaranteed a ticket for each match.



From 8.15am Wednesday 15th November: Members who recorded a minimum of 4 games wishing to purchase tickets for the following fixtures:

Manchester City; Tottenham Hotspur; Brighton & Hove Albion

Tickets for this sale will be sold strictly on a first come first served basis subject to availability, and we cannot guarantee that tickets will be available to all that apply.



From 8.15am Thursday 16th November: ALL Members wishing to purchase tickets for the following games:

West Ham United; Newcastle United; Watford; AFC Bournemouth; Stoke City

Tickets for this sale will be sold strictly on a first come first served basis subject to availability, and we cannot guarantee that tickets will be available to all that apply.

BREAKING: Emre Can is almost certain to leave Liverpool next summer. (Dominic King)

For all the discussions that have taken place with Can it has reached the point where there appears to be no solution. (Dominic King)

Liverpool have refused to agree to a release clause and will not make any special dispensation in this case for Can. (Dominic King)

Can will be able to start negotiating with clubs on the continent in 58 days about signing a pre-contract. (Dominic King)

The biggest concern for Liverpool, however, is they are now likely to lose a multi-million asset without recouping a penny. (Dominic King)

For the moment, Can's priority is helping Liverpool reach the knockout stages of the Champions League. (Dominic King)

While it is unlikely Wijnaldum will play against West Ham on Saturday, he is not on crutches & is awaiting results of a scan. (Dominic King)
